text: Michael "Mike" Hogewood (September 13, 1954 - September 5, 2018) was an American sportscaster. He was born in Greensboro, North Carolina. He was a freelance play-by-play announcer. He worked with Raycom Sports. Hogewood was best known for his work on ACC football games, ACC men's and women's basketball, as well as for anchoring Raycom's coverage of Nextel Cup NASCAR races. Hogewood did play-by-play for FSN South, Sun Sports, New England Sports Network, Comcast SportsNet, HDNet and the Speed Channel.raycomsports.com - Mike Hogewood He later worked for WFMY-TV Channel 2 (1987â€“2001).Sports director Hogewood hangs up his spikes at WFMY-TV Hogewood worked for NBC affiliate WXII-TV in Winston-Salem, North Carolina in the early 2000s on a series called Hog's Heroes. Hogewood retired in 2013 after 26 years as a sports broadcaster.
